source.title: Ligate the 3´ SR Adaptor

source.description:
Mix the following components in a sterile nuclease-free PCR tube. It is ok to premix the reagents. Use immediately.
AB
1Input RNA1-6 µl
2(green) 3 ́ SR Adaptor for Illumina1 µl
3Nuclease-Free Watervariable
4Total volume7 µl

source.body: For total RNA inputs of 100 ng, dilute the (green) 3´ SR Adaptor for Illumina 1:2 (For example: 1 µl of 3´ SR adaptor and 1 µl nuclease-free water) in nuclease-free water. For total RNA inputs closer to 1 µg, do not further dilute the adaptor. Adaptor dilutions may need to be optimized further.

source.title: Ligate the 3´ SR Adaptor

source.description:
Incubate in a preheated thermal cycler for
at
. Transfer tube to ice.

source.title: Ligate the 3´ SR Adaptor

source.description:
Add and mix the following components. It is ok to premix the reagents. Use immediately.
AB
1(green) 3 ́ Ligation Reaction Buffer (2X)10 µl
2(green) 3 ́ Ligation Enzyme Mix3 µl
3Total volume20 µl

source.title: Ligate the 3´ SR Adaptor

source.description:
Incubate for
at
in a thermal cycler.

source.body: Longer incubation times and reduced temperatures ( ; ) increase ligation efficiency of methylated RNAs such as piwi-interacting RNAs (piRNAs) (if present in the sample). However, some concatamerization products might be formed.

source.title: Hybridize the Reverse Transcription Primer

source.description: This section is important to prevent adaptor-dimer formation. The SR RT Primer hybridizes to the excess of 3´ SR Adaptor (that remains free after the 3´ ligation reaction) and transforms the single stranded DNA adaptor into a double-stranded DNA molecule. dsDNAs are not substrates for ligation mediated by T4 RNA Ligase 1 and therefore do not ligate to the 5´ SR Adaptor in the subsequent ligation step.

source.body: For total RNA inputs of 100 ng, dilute the (pink) SR RT Primer for Illumina 1:2 in nuclease free water. For total RNA inputs closer to 1 µg do not dilute the primer. Depending on the small RNA quantity and quality of your sample additional dilution optimization may be required.

source.title: Hybridize the Reverse Transcription Primer

source.description:
Add and mix the following components to the ligation mixture from Step 4 and mix well. It is ok to premix the reagents.
AB
1Nuclease-Free Water4.5 µl
2(pink) SR RT Primer for Illumina1 µl
3Total volume now should be25.5 µl

source.title: nuclease free water

source.body: For total RNA inputs closer to 100 ng, additionally dilute the (yellow) 5´ SR Adaptor for Illumina 1:2 in nuclease free water. For total RNA inputs closer to 1 µg do not dilute the adaptor further.

source.title: Ligate the 5´ SR Adaptor

source.description: Aliquot the (yellow) 5´ SR Adaptor into a separate, nuclease-free 200 µl PCR tube, for the number of samples in the experiment plus an excess of 10%.

source.title: Ligate the 5´ SR Adaptor

source.description:
Incubate the adaptor in the thermal cycler at
for
and then immediately place the tube on ice. Keep the tube on ice and use the denatured adaptor within
of denaturation.

source.body: Store the remaining resuspended 5´ SR adaptor at . Denature aliquots before use. Please minimize freeze/thaw cycles. If only a few libraries are to be made at a time, the 5´ SR adaptor could be aliquoted.

source.title: Ligate the 5´ SR Adaptor

source.description:

AB

2(yellow) 5 ́ Ligation Reaction Buffer (10X)1 µl
3(yellow) 5 ́ Ligation Enzyme Mix2.5 µl
4Total volume30 µl

source.title: Perform Reverse Transcription

source.description:
Mix the following components in a sterile, nuclease-free tube. It is ok to premix the reagents. Use immediately.
AB
1Adaptor Ligated RNA from Step 1230 µl
2(red) First Strand Synthesis Reaction Buffer8 µl
3(red) Murine RNase Inhibitor1 µl
4(red) ProtoScript IIReverse Transcriptase1 µl
5Total volume40 µl

source.title: Perform Reverse Transcription

source.description: Immediately proceed to PCR amplifcation.

source.body: Safe Stopping Point: If you do not plan to proceed immediately to PCR amplifcation, then heat inactivate the RT reaction at for . Samples can be safely stored at to

source.title: Perform PCR Amplifcation

source.description:
Add and mix the following components to the RT reaction mix from Step 14 and mix well:
AB
1(blue) LongAmp Taq 2X Master Mix50 µl
2(blue) SR Primer for Illumina2.5 µl
3(blue) Index (X) Primer*2.5 µl
4Nuclease free water5 µl
5Total volume now should be100 µl

source.body: * Note: The NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina Set 1 contains 1–12 PCR primers, set 2 contains 23-24 PCR primers, kit index primers 1-48 PCR primer, each with a different index. For each reaction, only one of the 12 PCR primer indices is used during the PCR step.

source.title: Perform PCR Amplifcation

source.description:
PCR Cycling conditions:
ABCD
1CYCLE STEPTEMPTIMECYCLES
2Initial Denaturation94°C30 sec1
3Denaturation94°C15 sec12-15*
4Annealing62°C30 sec
5Extension70°C15 sec
6Final Extension70°C5 min1
7Hold4°C∞
*Amplifcation conditions may vary based on RNA input amount, tissue, and species. This protocol was optimized using 1 µg of total RNA from human brain and 12 PCR cycles. The number of PCR cycles may need to be adjusted if clear and distinct bands are not observed in the gel image. For 100 ng total RNA input run 15 cycles of PCR. For samples containing high amounts of small RNA, less than 12 cycles may be appropriate.

source.body: Safe Stopping Point: It is safe to store the library at after PCR. Avoid leaving the sample at overnight if possible.

source.title: Quality Control Check and Size Selection

source.description:
There are several different methods for performing size selection. It is recommended to choose the appropriate method based on the QC check of the library using the Bioanalyzer. Size selection using AMPure XP Beads does not remove small fragments. If you perform the QC check and your sample contains Adaptor dimer (127 bp peak) or excess primers (70-80 bp) it is recommended to use gel or Pippin Prep for size selection. Please selcet either case Option A, Option B, or Option C below.
Option A: QC Check and Size Selection using 6% PolyAcrylamide Gel
Option B: QC Check and Size Selection Using Pippin Prep
Size selection of the Small RNA library (147 bp) can done on Pippin Prep instrument using the 3% Agarose, dye free gel with internal standards (Sage Science # CDP3010).
Option C: QC Check and Size Selection using AMPure XP Beads
Bead size selection is only recommended for samples showing no primer dimer and no adaptor dimer on Bioanalyzer. It will be suitable to remove peaks > 150 bp. If fragments larger than 150 bp are abundant, two rounds of bead size selection may be necessary to completely eliminate the high molecular weight fragments.

cases.title: Option A
cases.label: QC Check and Size Selection using 6% PolyAcrylamide Gel

cases.title: Option B
cases.label: QC Check and Size Selection Using Pippin Prep

cases.title: Option C
cases.label: QC Check and Size Selection using AMPure XP Beads

source.description: The 140 and 150 nucleotide bands correspond to adapter-ligated constructs derived from the 21 and 30 nucleotide RNA fragments, respectively. For miRNAs, isolate the bands corresponding to ~140 bp. For piRNAs, isolate the band corresponding to ~150 bp. For other small RNA, the band size may be different.

source.title: QC Check and Size Selection using AMPure XP Beads

source.description:
Completely remove the residual ethanol, and air dry beads for up to
while the tube is on the magnetic stand with lid open.
Caution: Do not overdry the beads, which may result in lower recovery of the DNA target. Elute the sample when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.

materials.name: NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (1-12) - 96 rxns
NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (1-12) - 24 rxns
NEBNext Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (Multiplex Compatible) - 96 rxns
NEBNext Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (Multiplex Compatible) - 24 rxns
NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (Set 2) - 96 rxns
NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (Set 2) - 24 rxns
NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (1-48) - 96 rxns

description:
The NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina contains the adaptors, primers, enzymes and buffers required to convert small RNAs into indexed libraries for next generation sequencing on the Illumina platform. The novel workflow has been optimized to minimized adaptor dimers, while producing high-yield, high-diversity libraries.
The unique workflow of the NEBNext® Small RNA library prep kits addresses the challenge of minimization of adaptor-dimers while achieving production of high-yield, diverse multiplex libraries in a simple protocol.
  • Minimized adaptor-dimer contamination
  • High yields
  • Input RNA can be Total RNA
  • Suitable for methylated small RNAs (e.g., piRNAs) as well as unmethylated small RNAs
Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Workflow
This kit includes a novel protocol that results in higher yields and lower adaptor-dimer contamination.
